conclusion: The point light source must be located at the center of the glass sphere.
The refractive index of the glass sphere is higher than that of the air.
Light rays will be refracted towards the normal when passing from the glass to the air.
If the light source is not at the center, some light rays will be internally reflected back into the sphere.
If the light source is at the center, all light rays will pass through the sphere and exit into the air.
The condition that the point light source must satisfy is that it must be located at the center of the glass sphere.
